alert.note: Alert for Canadian; Cleveland; Grady; McClain; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 9:00AM CDT until June 08 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Canadian County in central Oklahoma... Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Central Grady County in central Oklahoma... McClain County in central Oklahoma... Southern Oklahoma County in central Oklahoma... * Until noon CDT. * At 900 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Southern Oklahoma City, Norman, Moore, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Purcell, Mustang, Noble, Tuttle, Slaughterville, Lexington, Goldsby, Union City, Minco, Dibble, Valley Brook, Wayne, Washington and Cole. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 84 and 122. Interstate 44 between mile markers 70 and 116. Interstate 40 between mile markers 167 and 169. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 13. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
